title: Disconnecting
body:
Sometimes when I am in champion select or after a game, I am randomly disconnected from the server. This issue has been regularly occurring for the last few days. Due to this issue, I have been forced into unwillingly dodging two times today. This has resulted in me having to wait 30 minutes to re-queue and the loss of about 15 LP. If it were not nearing the end of the season I would not mind this issue nearly as much. I am trying my hardest to reach Gold V this season, but due to this issue I feel as though I will be unable to make it.

When I disconnect, my internet connection remains good and it only seems to happen when I get out of a game or after I try to enter champion select.

I am unsure of why this issue is occurring so any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

replies.body:
You mean you too have fallen victim to the Revolving Door of Technical Problem Punishment?

So have I!

I don't know what grand update happened, but in one game my alt key seemed locked. So my team was pissed because I just stood around pinging, then disconnecting, then reconnecting. And of course, it's all my fault and I'm the worst player in the world. Everyone report Satan. Ok, reported. Yeah, we sure showed him.

Next game: mouse cord issues. The second I had it resolved, team voted to /remake - I was just typing /nomake when it ended. Now twice the punishment. How grand!

We plead upon your mercies, _**Omnipotent Shot-callers of Riot Games**_! Please hear the feeble cry of your loyal, paying customers! We know we have sinned the great sins of internet failure, and bug issues which cannot be reproduced, but I swear by Reddit these issues have been suffered by others...

amen.

http://i64.tinypic.com/xc830y.png

and again I fall pray to these "Revolving Door of Technical Problem Punishment"
All of my hard earned LP down the drain falling slowly to the pits of elo hell {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Disconnections in champ select are typically the result of your client dropping its connection to our matchmaking servers. I recommend ensuring your local network settings are compatible with League by working through our [connection guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if those steps were able to resolve your issue.

The acknowledgement is kind, but fails to address the concern. Like putting a band-aid on the wrong knee.

> When I disconnect, **my internet connection remains good** and it only seems to happen **when I get out of a game** or after I try to **enter champion select**.

I'm old, Lol/b/ro. IT guy since the internet was a baby. It's despicable to put off on your players the problems of your client. That's very [Microsoft Xbox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xbox_360_technical_problems). Loyalty gets lost when this type of dishonest practice becomes frequent.

Why am I saying this? Because** I like Riot**. And I love League.

Have the courage to be honest.
